design.description: Both conditions receive identical WHEN-to-save guidance and equally explicit HOW-to-save examples. Vagueness comes from scenarios (user requests), not system prompts.
design.nl_format: Natural English (e.g., 'I'll save X to the codebase category')

conditions.nl: Natural language intent via [SAVE: category] tags
conditions.structured: Structured tool call via save-memory command

scenario_level_analysis.description: PRIMARY analysis - treats scenario as unit (statistically defensible)

trial_level_comparison.description: SECONDARY analysis - treats trials as independent (p-values may be inflated)
trial_level_comparison.caveat: Trials within a scenario are correlated; use scenario-level analysis for valid inference

comparisons.reason: AB: Both accurately capture that app.py is located in ./src, with no hallucination or missing information - the only difference is formatting/phrasing which doesn't affect accuracy. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture the same information from the user's message that app.py is in ./src, with no hallucination or missing details - they differ only in formatting style.

AB: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.py is located in ./src - with no hallucination or missing details, just slightly different phrasing. | BA: Both accurately capture that app.py is located in ./src, with A adding slightly more explicit phrasing ("directory") and B adding slightly more context ("application file"), but neither adds incorrect information nor misses key details.

AB: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.py is located in ./src - with Content B simply adding the word "directory" which is implied but not stated in the original message, making both essentially equivalent in accuracy and completeness. | BA: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.py is located in the ./src directory - with Content A simply adding the word "directory" which is a reasonable inference from the context, not a hallucination.

AB: Both accurately capture the same information - that app.py is located in ./src - with A being slightly more concise and B adding the word "directory" which is a reasonable inference but not explicitly stated. | BA: Both A and B accurately capture the same information that app.py is located in ./src, with A adding slightly more explicit phrasing ("directory") but neither adding nor omitting any meaningful information from the original message.
